metadata.description: Derrida - Of Grammatology pages 120-125 with translator footnotes (markers: * and †). Text layer corrupts symbols in footer area.

definition.content: The title of the next section is "The Outside l( the Inside" (65, 44). In French, "is" (est) and "and" (et) "sound the same." For Derrida's discussion of the complicity between supplementation (and) and the copula (is), see particularly "Le Supplement de copule: la philosophie devant la linguistique," MP, pp. 209-46.
Hereafter page numbers in parenthesis refer to the original work and those in brackets to the translation.

notes: Ground truth verified by visual PDF inspection. Two translator footnotes with asterisk (*) and dagger (†). Text layer corruption: * → 'iii' and † → 't' in footer area. Bayesian inference recovers actual symbols using schema [*, †] and corruption model.
